metadata.name: Powershell WMI Persistence
metadata.comment: Adversaries may establish persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event subscription.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('new-ciminstance ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-namespace root/subscription ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-classname __eventfilter ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-property ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('new-ciminstance ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-namespace root/subscription ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-classname commandlineeventconsumer ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-property ')))

output.summary: Adversaries may establish persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event subscription.
